top_cited_paper.title: IoT security techniques based on machine learning: How do IoT devices use AI to enhance security?
top_cited_paper.authors: L Xiao, X Wan, X Lu, Y Zhang

federated_learning_prototype.evaluation: The model demonstrates moderate performance with good privacy preservation. Further improvements are needed to balance performance and privacy.

proposed_advancements.name: Enhanced Differential Privacy in Federated Learning
proposed_advancements.description: Improve the current implementation by using adaptive noise addition based on the sensitivity of the data and the desired privacy budget.
proposed_advancements.potential_impact: Better balance between model performance and privacy preservation.

proposed_advancements.name: Secure Multi-Party Computation for AI Security
proposed_advancements.description: Implement secure multi-party computation techniques to allow multiple parties to jointly compute a function over their inputs while keeping those inputs private.
proposed_advancements.potential_impact: Enable collaborative AI model training and inference without exposing sensitive data.

proposed_advancements.name: Quantum-Resistant Encryption for AI Models
proposed_advancements.description: Develop and integrate post-quantum cryptographic algorithms to protect AI models and data against potential threats from quantum computers.
proposed_advancements.potential_impact: Future-proof AI systems against emerging quantum computing threats.
